privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.summary: This policy explains which data is processed through the website, why it is processed, how long it is retained, and your rights.

sections.heading: Data controller
content: The website data controller is Raphael Rouiller.
For any data protection request, contact privacy@nyvoro-records.com.

sections.heading: Data we collect
content: When you submit an application, we process data you provide: artist identity, contact details, project information, release history, audience metrics, resources, and free-form message.
We also process technical anti-spam signals: Turnstile verification outcome (Cloudflare), honeypot value, and a pseudonymized IP hash (salted).
We do not run advertising pixels or marketing analytics tracking in the application workflow.
The website stores only a local theme preference (light/dark/auto) in your browser for display comfort.

sections.heading: Purposes and legal bases
content: Application data is used to assess artistic fit, organize editorial follow-up, and reply to candidates.
Security and anti-spam processing is used to protect the service against automated abuse and malicious attempts.
Primary legal basis is Nyvoro Records' legitimate interest under Swiss FADP; where GDPR applies, corresponding legal bases are used.

sections.heading: Recipients and international transfers
content: Data is accessible only to authorized Nyvoro Records members and strictly required technical processors (hosting, anti-spam, email routing).
Depending on provider setup, some processing may involve transfers outside Switzerland and/or the EEA with appropriate safeguards (standard contractual clauses or equivalent mechanisms).
No sale of personal data is carried out.

sections.heading: Retention period
content: Applications are retained for 24 months from submission to support artistic and operational follow-up.
After that period, data is deleted or anonymized unless legal obligations require a longer retention.

sections.heading: Security measures
content: We apply proportionate technical and organizational safeguards, including rate limiting, anti-spam protections, HTTP security hardening, and restricted data access.
Applications are stored in a dedicated SQLite database with operational logging suitable for service continuity.

sections.heading: Your rights
content: Under Swiss FADP and, where applicable, GDPR, you may request access, rectification, erasure, restriction, objection, and portability where applicable.
You may also withdraw consent where consent is the legal basis, without affecting prior lawful processing.
To exercise your rights, contact privacy@nyvoro-records.com.

sections.heading: Complaints
content: If you believe your rights are not respected, you may lodge a complaint with the Swiss Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner (FDPIC/PFPDT).
If GDPR applies to your situation, you may also contact your competent local supervisory authority in the EU/EEA.

sections.heading: Policy updates
content: This policy may evolve to reflect regulatory, technical, or organizational changes.
The last updated date displayed at the top of the document is authoritative.
